alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 6:16PM MST until July 19 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 614 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from the Star Valley area northward over the Houston Creek drainage. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with the heaviest amounts over the upper reaches of the Houston Creek drainage. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Star Valley. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ellison Creek, Dry Pocket Wash, Green Valley Creek, Houston Creek, Pyeatt Draw, East Verde River and Gibson Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
